status_notes: Case Closed. Case Noted. During this period of unprecedented snow accumulation, the Boston Transportation Department has been working diligently with the Department of Public Works and other City agencies to coordinate snow removal operations and ensure that roadways are not impeded. BTD is making every effort to ticket and tow vehicles for impeding travel lanes, and will continue to do so.
description: The closest intersecting street: South street | How is the car parked illegally? Handicapped parking space | Details: Details: heading on commonwealth ave(2012 comm ave through Cleveland circle ) east in Brighton towards Cleveland circle there are two lanes set for vehicles going straight. The further lane on the right is completely blocked off by parked vehicles. Usually these vehicles park legally to the right of this rightmost travel lane but due to the snow accumulation their owners have decided to park in a manner that eliminates the right most lane from use. This is in violation of Article 4 section 1 of the traffic rules and regulation for the city of Boston, specifically: 9. Upon any roadway, unless both wheels on the side of the vehicle adjacent to the curb are within one (1’) foot of the curb or edge of the roadway, except where angle parking is permitted or commercial vehicles, as defined, are permitted to back to the curb or edge of the roadway. 10. Upon any roadway where the parking of a vehicle will not leave a clear and unobstructed lane at least ten (10’) feet wide on a one-way street and twenty (20’) feet wide on a two-way street for passing traffic. 11. In excess of one (1) vehicle width from the curb or edge of a roadway. These regulations can be found at http://www.cityofboston.gov/images_documents/Traffic%20Rules%20and%20Regulations_tcm3-1654.pdf These parked vehicles do not have the right to obstruct traffic because their normal parking area is snow covered. It created bottlenecks of traffic at all times and is a clear violation of the above cited law.

description: How is the car parked illegally? Other | Details: heading on brookline ave from Brookline into Fenway towards the Riverway there are two lanes set for vehicles going straight. The further lane on the right is completely blocked off by parked vehicles. Usually these vehicles park legally to the right of this rightmost travel lane but due to the snow accumulation their owners have decided to park in a manner that eliminates the right most lane from use. This is in violation of Article 4 section 1 of the traffic rules and regulation for the city of Boston, specifically: 9. Upon any roadway, unless both wheels on the side of the vehicle adjacent to the curb are within one (1’) foot of the curb or edge of the roadway, except where angle parking is permitted or commercial vehicles, as defined, are permitted to back to the curb or edge of the roadway. 10. Upon any roadway where the parking of a vehicle will not leave a clear and unobstructed lane at least ten (10’) feet wide on a one-way street and twenty (20’) feet wide on a two-way street for passing traffic. 11. In excess of one (1) vehicle width from the curb or edge of a roadway. These regulations can be found at http://www.cityofboston.gov/images_documents/Traffic%20Rules%20and%20Regulations_tcm3-1654.pdf These parked vehicles do not have the right to obstruct traffic because their normal parking area is snow covered. It created bottlenecks of traffic at all times and is a clear violation of the above cited law.
address: Intersection Of Brookline Ave & Riverway, Boston
